question: This is the view south from the biggest city in Andalusia, Spain. What is the city called?
instructions: You are looking south over the Mediterranean Sea. Head the east to find the Málaga Pompidou centre. Tip – it’s striking and colourful.
At the Pompidou centre, turn to head south along the marina promenade. Tip – the marina should be kept on the right. Use the pedestrian promenade, not the road.
Proceed to the Chapel of the Port of Málaga which is located on the left of the promenade, next to possibly the best restaurant in Málaga, the Restaurante José Carlos García.
Stand directly in front of the chapel, and from the water please collect your token.

question: This is the view from the northern tip of the largest lake in Italy. What is that lake called?
instructions: You are looking south down Lake Garda from the town of Riva Del Garda. Head west into the town square.
Take the pedestrian street to the left of the clock tower - Torre Apponale.
Follow the street until you get to a museum located on the water, accessed by a bridge.
Orientate south and head to the lake, just to the left of the blue kiosks. Head all the way to the waterfront.
